title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonicsb. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for the super class), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeNamef. The label could say 'Select destination type:'g. The browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).c. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.e. The destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
OB: The browse button is small in size. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it displays 'Type not found'. Types from the source folders of other projects are also shown in the dialog. Refactoring warns that changing the destination type to the source type will result in errors and makes changes in all referencing classes.
EB: The browse button should have a standard size. The title should not be used for long text. When going to the next page, it should display a more specific error message. Only types from the source folders of the current project should be shown in the dialog. Refactoring should not falsely warn about errors when changing the destination type to the source type.
SR:
To reproduce the bug, follow these steps:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Observe the size of the browse button.
3. Enter long text in the title field.
4. Go to the next page and observe the displayed error message.
5. Check if types from the source folders of other projects are shown in the dialog.
6. Attempt to change the destination type to the source type and check if any warning about errors is displayed.
